key_points.text:
Seaport Res Ptn raised its Q2 2025 EPS estimate for GD to $3.60 from $3.44, reflecting stronger expected near-term profitability.
Seaport Res Ptn Issues Optimistic Outlook for GD Earnings
Neutral Sentiment:
RBC Capital maintained a “Hold” rating on GD, signaling a wait-and-see stance rather than an

Ahead of General Dynamics (GD) Q2 Earnings: Get Ready With Wall Street Estimates for Key Metrics
Neutral Sentiment:
Broader defense-sector optimism—fueled by a $150 billion boost to U.S. defense spending—positions GD alongside peers in the Pentagon’s drone-centric modernization push.

Negative Sentiment:
Seaport Res Ptn cut its Q4 2025 EPS forecast for GD to $4.09 from $4.22, indicating concerns about late-year margin pressure.
General Dynamics Corporation (NYSE: GD) has seen its stock react to a mix of analyst estimate revisions, peer comparisons and sector developments in the past 24–36 hours.
A Zacks analysis shows peer Howmet (HWM) outpacing GD with a 142% gain and stronger EPS growth forecasts, underscoring competitive headwinds in the aerospace & defense space.
